channel.title: 2009 Mustang / Police Interceptor
channel.description:
So here’s what I’ve been working on lately. I've spent a little over 90 hours on it for the past month and a half. It's hard to say because I've worked on it 1 hour and 30 minutes almost every day to and from school for the past five weeks, and pretty much whenever I had a break at school. All reference images for Mustangs that aren’t the stock edition are different than each other so a lot of creativity and guess work was involved. Even more so with the police car version. I did a lot of studying of actual police cars and just tried to incorporate them into the Mustang. Comments/Criticisms? I don't know if I'm completely done with it, cause I have a few more things in mind.
[img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/blue_view_1.jpg[/img] [img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/blue_view_2.jpg[/img] [img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/blue_view_3.jpg[/img] [img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/blue_view_4.jpg[/img] [img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/blue_view_5.jpg[/img] [img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/cop_view_1.jpg[/img] [img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/cop_view_2.jpg[/img] [img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/cop_view_3.jpg[/img] [img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/cop_view_4.jpg[/img] [img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/cop_view_5.jpg[/img]

item.title: 2009 Mustang / Police Interceptor
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Frell:

Still, the front should be reflecting the outdoors from the open garage door.

Think about the law of reflection. Trace a ray from the camera to the surface. An exact line will bounce off that normal, at an angle equal to the exact angle you look at it, measured from the perpindicular face of the normal. You know:

The only faces that can then see the outside from you looking at this angle would be, the only ones that are actually reflecting the outside. The front of the hood and the bottom of the bumper.

It makes sense. The only way the front tops could be reflecting the outside is if the car was poking out more.

Read full topic

item.title: 2009 Mustang / Police Interceptor
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Still, the front should be reflecting the outdoors from the open garage door.

item.title: 2009 Mustang / Police Interceptor
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:44, topic:296140”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=392169.msg2929027#msg2929027 date=1251159886]

looks totally unrealistic there

And you don’t say why.
[/quote]
i dont know. im not a graphics guy, i just think it looks unrealistic. i wouldnt know the reason[/quote]

Just asking cause:

  1. Being colorblind and spending lots of time on things makes me lose my perspective on them
  2. Three other people around me were asking if i got a new car cause they thought it was real

Frell: Tip: dark things don’t reflect as much. The reflections you see of those cars are of what? The sky, bright things. The garage is pretty dark compared to outside. Thus, you get the reflection of the side wall which has more light hitting it, and a little off the front of the outside.

Read full topic

item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

runescape3dude:

it seems a bit too light at the back.

Although I tried to get rid of that (there’s almost no way to preserve front and get rid of the back), there is a really bright wall to the side of it (the only side you can’t see in the picture), so it makes sense to me cause I know that it’d be there.

Not really for you guys lol.

I purposely cut off a little lol.

item.title: 2009 Mustang / Police Interceptor
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:31, topic:296140”]The two lower hood scoops don’t look like they extrude from the hood in the bumper shot. And the upper scoop looks like there’s nothing behind the mesh.

The overhead lights could use some more work too. For me when I see that type of light on a police car, I can actually make out the LED’s inside of the box. I don’t know if it’s just me or not, but it seems like the reverse lights on both models are like a turquoise color.

EDIT: http://www.speedtechlights.com/product_detail.php?catid=5&id=88[/quote]

That’s because those hood scoops don’t extrude. They go inwards O.o There isn’t anything behind the mesh either. Why would there be?

I actually did model the light slightly after that kind of model, but around here they have that model which is more rectangular, and another kind which is almost exactly the same but has slightly tinted sections. I did it more based on that one, and I actually do have the little LEDs along the lights, but I upped the blurry refractions on the outside so you can’t see them detailed anymore.

I don’t know why they’d be turquoise, as the blue/green values are the same, and very low.

Read full topic

item.title: 2009 Mustang / Police Interceptor
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

The two lower hood scoops don’t look like they extrude from the hood in the bumper shot. And the upper scoop looks like there’s nothing behind the mesh.

The overhead lights could use some more work too. For me when I see that type of light on a police car, I can actually make out the LED’s inside of the box. I don’t know if it’s just me or not, but it seems like the reverse lights on both models are like a turquoise color.

EDIT: http://www.speedtechlights.com/product_detail.php?catid=5&id=88

Read full topic
